title: The Rocking Horse of Obedience
devotional:
The old wooden rocking horse sat in the attic, gathering dust. It wasn't just any rocking horse; it was a symbol of childhood, of joyful abandon and unwavering trust. Little Timmy, now a grown man named Timothy, remembered countless hours spent galloping across imaginary fields on its back, completely secure in the belief that the horse would never let him fall. He'd obeyed his imagination, let it guide him, and it always led to adventure. But life had a way of eroding that simple trust, replacing it with the weight of responsibility and the fear of making mistakes.

One day, while clearing out the attic, Timothy stumbled upon the rocking horse. As he ran his hand along its worn mane, a wave of nostalgia washed over him. He remembered the carefree joy of his childhood, the unwavering belief in the impossible. He realized that somewhere along the way, he had stopped obeying that inner voice, that childlike spirit that dared to dream and take risks.

Obedience to God often feels like that rocking horse ride – a leap of faith into the unknown, trusting that He will guide us, even when the path ahead seems uncertain. It's about surrendering our own plans and desires, and aligning ourselves with His will, even when it doesn't make sense to our limited understanding. It requires a willingness to step outside our comfort zones and embrace the adventure He has called us to.

Just as little Timmy trusted the rocking horse to carry him safely, we are called to trust God to lead us on our journey. It's not always easy, and there will be times when we stumble and fall. But God's grace is always there to pick us up, dust us off, and set us back on the right path. Embrace the challenge, obey His call, and discover the joy and fulfillment that comes from living a life of faith.
image_description: A dusty, old wooden rocking horse sits in a dimly lit attic, with a single shaft of light illuminating its faded paint.
insights: The theme of obedience is central to the Christian faith. Deuteronomy 11:26-28 presents a clear choice between blessing and curse, based on obedience to God's commands. Jesus Himself emphasized the importance of obedience, stating in John 14:15, 'If you love me, you will keep my commandments.' Obedience is not merely following a set of rules, but a demonstration of our love and trust in God's wisdom and guidance. It reflects a heart that is willing to surrender to His will and follow His leading, even when it's difficult or uncomfortable.
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me for the times when I have resisted Your call and relied on my own understanding. Help me to cultivate a heart of obedience, willing to surrender my plans and follow Your leading. Grant me the courage to step outside my comfort zone and embrace the adventure You have called me to. Fill me with Your grace and wisdom, and guide me on the path You have set before me. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life are you struggling to obey God's call? What fears or doubts are holding you back? How can you cultivate a greater sense of trust in His wisdom and guidance?
